meanings.definition: Feeling weary because one is unoccupied or lacks interest in one's current activity.
meanings.sent1: The students were bored during the long lecture.
meanings.sent2: She looked bored while waiting for the bus.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed bored with its toy, so it found a new one.
meanings.sent4: The empty room felt bored without any decorations.
meanings.sent5: The rainy day made everyone feel bored and lazy.

meanings.definition: To make weary by being unoccupied or lacking interest.
meanings.sent1: The repetitive tasks bored him quickly.
meanings.sent2: She tried to avoid boring her audience with a long speech.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was so boring that it put the audience to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The endless meeting bored everyone to tears.
meanings.sent5: The movie's slow pace bored the viewers to frustration.

meanings.definition: To become weary by being unoccupied or lacking interest.
meanings.sent1: He tends to get bored easily during long flights.
meanings.sent2: The children bored of the game and decided to play something else.
meanings.sent3: The plant seemed to be bored of the same sunlight every day.
meanings.sent4: The dog quickly bored of its new toy and went back to the old one.
meanings.sent5: She felt herself slowly getting bored of the same routine.
